name: Jumbo
spokenText: Feel free to browse. I'll buy anything you have on you. If you're interested in my Gnome, Lumpy is just 1000gp.

name: Mayor Quellando
spokenText: Who are you? Get out of my house.

name: Angry Gnome
spokenText: Who are you? What do you want? Sounds pretty stupid to me.

name: Mining Gnome
spokenText: Yes? I'm a little busy mining here.

name: Ugly Gnome
spokenText: Hello. Please don't look at me.

name: Strange Man
spokenText: One to start, no choice of course. One, two, travel true, one, one, don't run, three, three, almost free, two, two, and I'm through. HeHA! HeHAHA!

name: Old Man
spokenText: Membership card?

name: Grumpy Knight
spokenText: I won't let anyone pass unless they're better than me at swords and stuff.

name: Stupid Dwarf
spokenText: Hello. Do you have any cheese? I'd be eternally grateful.

name: Friendly Dwarf
spokenText: Hello. I'd love a job, if you could give me one.

name: Tholdbur the Dwarf
spokenText: Hello. I hear you are looking for a useful helper.

name: Dwarny
spokenText: Hello. I am a true dwarf, capable of carrying untold amounts of ore faster than any other. For a one time fee, I'll work for you.

name: Jeplomi
spokenText: You want to know about the culinary arts? All great culinary artists make sushi rolls by combining rice with seaweed, then adding a raw fish on top. The easiest sushi to make uses icefish. You can catch those up in the north sea.

name: Yondo-Mondo II
spokenText: You're interested in smithing? You'll need to find a smithy to smelt your ores into bars and hammer your bars into items. I've heard rumors of a smithy in Queple Cave, but I've never seen one myself.

name: Gish Garn
spokenText: See all these stones and berries? Worthless. Don't waste your time.

name: Traveller
spokenText: Beyond here is the great swamp. You won't make it to the other side without knowledge from someone who already has. Apparently a guy from Uragota Town made it out alive, but he's crazy now.

name: Man by Campfire
spokenText: I've heard of a place to the south that's so warm you can't travel across it without riding an animal. Don't believe a word of it, to be honest.

name: Strange Fish Man
spokenText: You won't get any further than here without a camel. Trust me, I would know.

name: Sign Post
spokenText: You speak to the sign post. It doesn't respond. Instead it says, 'East:The Great City of Chickenpull(ROAD CLOSED), West:The Great Swamp, South:More Wasteland, North:Higashi Woods'

name: Mr. Tote M Poll
spokenText: You see that totem pole? I put it there. Once you've learned the basics, feel free to use it to practice your woodworking. I've put a few of these things around the area for people to improve. Let's enjoy learning together!

name: Fence Guard
spokenText: If you want to get inside, you'll need to pay the entrance fee. The money all goes to supporting the town, so it's for a good cause!

name: Man at Register
spokenText: Don't mind old Weesun over there. He's just excited about chopping trees.

name: Shelf Stocker
spokenText: Chop Chop!

name: Gordo
spokenText: Hi, welcome to Mound's boats. I'm the new guy. Would you like a boat?

name: Old Man
spokenText: You're not from around here, are you? Up ahead is Tsu City, the capital of the Rising Hills. You can buy almost anything you want there.

name: Old Woman
spokenText: Oh, you're headed to Tsu City? They have a lovely garden there. It's just north of the castle.

name: Nursery Guard
spokenText: These trees are the property of Tsu City. You can't cut them down without permission!

name: Shady Hooded Person
spokenText: Would you like to learn more about alchemy? Visit the alchemic emporium on the east side of town. The information isn't free, of course.

name: Mr. Meat
spokenText: Hi there! I'm Mr. Meat. I love meat! Come to my shop and sell me your meat! Okay? See you there! Hahahaha!

name: Town Crier
spokenText: The crier ignores you as he cries out, 'The warriors guild is looking for new entrants! See the admissions counselor at the Settled Sea Horse for more information!'

name: Castle Archer Captain
spokenText: These training dummies are for our guards to practice on, but I suppose I could let you use them as well. They're specifically built to be good for shooting, so you won't get experience as quickly if you just try to beat them with melee weapons.

name: Untrustworthy-looking Salesman
spokenText: Wanna buy some art?

name: Food Stall Operator
spokenText: I've got all kinds of sushi rolls! Buy somethin' will ya?

name: Garden Guard
spokenText: The garden is 15000 gold coins to enter. What? You got a problem with that?

name: Doooligan Quellop
spokenText: Alchemy is built around an intrinsic property of metals, elements, and areas of strong elemental power. We call it a queplar value, and all metals, elements, and elemental halls have one. Elements have a negative queplar value, while metals and elemental halls have a positive value.

name: Goranjio Quellop
spokenText: Alchemy is still a new field, so we don't know the queplar values of very many things. What we can say for certain, is that Carquen has a value of -5.

name: Old Alchemist
spokenText: You seek information about alchemy? Do you know of queplar values? The alchemists in Tsu City south of the wasteland can tell you more, but I can tell you what I know. Copper is the only metal with a queplar value of 0, and the great hall here has a value of 25.

name: Excited Gnome
spokenText: You got a job for me? Yeah? Sure, I'll do it. I'm in. Just let me know. Yessir. Right away! Oh, but you'll need to pay me. Up front. Deal?

name: Slouching Gnome
spokenText: I'll work for you. Just show me the money!

name: Excited Traveller
spokenText: Did you see it?? All this cheese fell right out of the sky! This is the best day of my life!

name: Raka the Kushtaka
spokenText: I'll gladly help you bank your fish, if you pay me, of course.

name: Al the Kushtaka
spokenText: Need any help banking your fish?

name: Krim the Kushtaka
spokenText: I'm always available for hire. Just let me know when to start.

name: Sloodle the Kushtaka
spokenText: I love hard work and doing a good job. Need any help with fishing?

name: Wenshoop the Kushtaka
spokenText: I don't offer my services to just anyone, seeing how I'm the greatest fish-banker there ever was. But for a fee I suppose I could lend you a hand. You look like you need it...

name: Glindrear the Kushtaka
spokenText: Glindrear says nothing. The sign laying by his feet says, 'Will Work For Money'.

name: Tolani Seba the Scout
spokenText: If you need someone to scout out enemies for you to fight, I'd love to help.

name: Grib Grab Grub Grob the Goblin
spokenText: The hideous creature cries in a shrill voice:I love to sell things. I'll do it for you, for a price...

name: Mysterious Traveller
spokenText: Did you know there is a great river south of Quepland Woods? Meet me there and I'll show you. No strings attached.

name: Mysterious Traveller
spokenText: Greetings. I see you're interested in travelling somewhere new! Excellent. The forest is thick here, but if you can struggle through you'll reach the river in no time. Follow me.

name: Mysterious Raft Salesman
spokenText: Here we are! Wanna buy a raft? You'll need it to head down the river. What? Why are you looking at me like that?

name: Skia the Monopod
spokenText: I'm the best blacksmith in Quepland. I'll work for you if the price is right.

name: Farmer
spokenText: We don't see too many visitors around these parts. The restaurant here is run by one of the greatest chefs in the world. He's mostly retired now, though.

name: Man eating jerky
spokenText: I like jerky! That's why I always bring my meat to Tammy. In just a few days I can get all the jerky I can eat. Yum!

name: Old Man
spokenText: Would you like to learn more about the culinary arts? I can teach you, if you pay for the materials.

name: Old Woman
spokenText: He may not look it, but my husband is one of the greatest chefs in the world. There's a lot he could teach you.

name: Man with pipe
spokenText: Hey man. We got all kinds of interesting things here. Check it out!

name: Tammy
spokenText: Welcome! You seem like an adventurer. Would you be interested in making use of my curing and tanning facilities?

name: Ancient Alchemist
spokenText: Welcome to the Wind Hall. Inside you will find one of the great elemental portals which allows alchemists to perform alchemy. All that is required of you is a metal and one of the base elements. Finding the right recipe can be time consuming, but very rewarding.

name: Woodworker
spokenText: They've got some lovely adzes over there. And look at the kerfs on these! Wow.

name: Man behind booth
spokenText: Welcome to the Woodworkers' Association. We're a small group, but steadily growing! Can I interest you in some overpriced gloves?

name: Garden Sign
spokenText: The sign reads:Entry Fee: 5 Gold Coins

name: Mysterious Traveller
spokenText: Did you know there is a great river south of Quepland Woods? Meet me there and I'll show you. No strings attached.

name: Excited Chicken Man
spokenText: Killing all these chickens sure is exciting! I can't wait to attach them to my arrow shafts, I need lots of arrows to kill all these chickens!

name: Toby McGurga
spokenText: Are you interested in sharpening a sword in my whetstone? That's fine by me, but you'll have to do something in return. Bring me 1000 teeth from baobhan siths and I'll let you sharpen a sword on it.

name: Mr. Doorly
spokenText: You look like an adventurer. Any interest in buying a pet? Come to my store anytime and we'll see if we can find you something you like.

name: Thunkirn the Dwarf
spokenText: Well what are you waiting for? I can smell the money on you. You know the drill, pay me a pile of gold and I'll work for you. I'm the best ore hauler you've ever met, probably.

name: The Pet Forgetter
spokenText: Hi, I'm the pet forgetter. I'll take care of all your pet needs. Just show me your pet and tell me what you want it to forget, and I'll take it out back and help it forget. We have two courses to choose from. Would you like your pet to forget one level, or make them forget all the way back to level 1?

name: The Pet Forgetter2
spokenText: The exact method is a trade secret, but I'm quite skilled in a number of fields of magic. This big stick helps a lot, too.

name: Kaiken
spokenText: Welcome to our humble dojo. If you'd like, you may challenge us for our dojo's title. I'll warn you though, an untrained novice will not easily defeat us.

name: Anthropos en tayn Agros the Scout
spokenText: They call me Anthropos. I'd consider working for you, if you prove your worth. Bring me dojo tokens as evidence of your fighting abilities.

name: Token
spokenText: Welcome to our dojo. You will find it much more difficult to defeat us than the dojo of the knives on Mt. Queple. Prepare yourself!

name: Belt Man the Proud
spokenText: I was so close to beating the dojo! It's so frustrating. They don't even give out consolation tokens. Hey, do you have any dojo tokens? I'll trade you with some stuff I found!

name: Betty May
spokenText: Are you interested in entering Koncave city? Maybe we can strike a deal. I'm looking for some seeds from the Great Tree, but the best place to find them is crawling with strange creatures.

name: Hitty May
spokenText: Wanna buy a passport to Koncave city? I'll sell you mine, I don't need it anymore.

name: City Guard
spokenText: Only citizens of Koncave city are allowed to enter. I don't recognize you, where's your passport?

name: Smokey
spokenText: Welcome to our dojo. We're pretty chill as far as dojos go, but that doesn't mean we'll go easy on you!

name: Jason
spokenText: Hi! We aren't quite open for business yet, please come back in a few days.

name: Alphonse
spokenText: That's what I've been saying this whole time! There's no point to it, none at all!

name: Edward
spokenText: You just need to be patient! In a short while we'll figure this all out, preparation is a necessity!

name: Not Dead Jed
spokenText: Hello, welcome to Don't Die Inc. How can I help you survive today?

name: Pumpy the Gnome
spokenText: Hey. You look pretty ENERGIZED to me! I would love to haul logs for you. Just give me some money first, okay? I'm pumped up! Yeah!
